trustfund: TF023165-EMERGENCY RECOVERY & RECONSTRUCTION/ERRP,TF022195-EMERGENCY RECOVERY & RECONSTRUCTION/ERRP,TF024305-SOCIAL REHABILITATION FUND (ERRP)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Recovery and
            Reconstruction Project for Ethiopia were as follows:
            outcomes were highly satisfactory, project sustainability
            was likely, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: the most important lesson that can be drawn from
            the successful implementation of ERRP is that the high-level
            of commitment of both the Transitional Government of
            Ethiopia (TGE) and the Bank were critical to the
            project's success. Staff of implementing agencies also
            needs to be trained early in procurement and disbursement
            procedures with periodic refresher courses during project
            implementation to maintain the level of efficiency and
            effectiveness in the face of possible staff turnovers.
            Constant review of the liquidity problems of the borrower
            and introduction of arrangements, such as the Master Special
            Commitment (MSC) where necessary, to speed up procurement
            disbursement activities should be considered by
            International Development Association (IDA) in future
            emergency recovery projects.
